node.title: 'Changing climate': Homes lost as hundreds of firefighters battle spate of destructive blazes in Western Australia
node.alt: A burnt out car with barely anything left except the frame
node.description: Authorities say changing climate conditions are a factor in the increased intensity of fires as crews battleÂ dangerous and destructive blazes.
node.content:
["Hundreds of firefighters in Western Australia spent the weekend battling four blazes that ravaged Western Australia's south, razing several properties, some businesses and critically injuring one man.", "A fire burning in Bridgetown, in the state's South West, is still at an emergency level as well as a blaze\u00a0in the Corrigin area in WA's agricultural Wheatbelt region.\u00a0", "Aided by dropping temperatures and some rain, a bushfire that had been burning in Denmark, in the state's Great Southern, since Friday morning\u00a0was downgraded yesterday.", "A second Wheatbelt blaze near Narrogin was also downgraded overnight.", "The four fires burned through more than 60,000 hectares of bushland, destroyed at least six homes and damaged businesses, sparking widespread power outages for thousands of residents.", "", "
By Sunday afternoon, four fires in Western Australia were at an emergency level.(Supplied: Emily Harper)
", "A Bridgetown resident was sent on the 270-kilometre journey to Fiona Stanley hospital in Perth in a critical condition after being burned while defending his property.", "The local hospital had been evacuated on Saturday, with patients and staff yet to return.", "Detectives from the arson squad were sent to the Bridgetown fire zone to investigate whether the South West inferno was deliberately lit as residents anxiously wait to find out just how many properties had been lost in the two devastating blazes.", "Department of Fire and Emergency Service Commissioner Darren Klemm said on Sunday four homes in the Denmark region had been lost in the fire, and another home had been damaged. Four other structures had also been razed.", "", "
Brendan Laing, a South Coast Highway resident,\u00a0stayed to defend his property during the Denmark blaze.
", "Mr Klemm said a\u00a0home in Hester, near Bridgetown, had also been destroyed.", "Some Bridgetown residents were allowed back into their homes to retrieve essentials and residents in Boyup Brook were advised by the Water Corporation to limit their water use, after the fire cut power to the pump stations supplying the town's water tank.", "The bushfire in the Corrigin area tore through a vast area of farmland and torched at least one home.", "\"We've lost a lot of\u00a0farmland and one house we know of, other sheds, and bits and pieces in the district,\" Shire of Corrigin President Des Hickey said.\u00a0", "
Changing climate fuels intensity
", "Mr Klemm said the frequency and intensity of weather events in the state were results of a \"changing climate\".", "", "
DFES Commissioner Darren Klemm says weather events in the state had become more severe.(ABC News: Jessica Warriner)
", "\"An example of that (is)\u00a0on Friday night the fire in Denmark doubled in size overnight. For one of the most southern parts of our state, to have a fire double in size overnight is not territory we have been in often before.\"", "Mr Klemm said the fire near Bridgetown also spread rapidly after it had been reported just after noon on Saturday.", "\"Really rapid rates of spread were fed back to us in terms of reports from the fire ground ... particularly difficult conditions, 42 degrees in Bridgetown yesterday, minus one dew point\u00a0and really strong winds which made this fire incredibly difficult to control,\" he said.", "In December senior firefighters\u00a0told the ABC that bushfire behaviour\u00a0was changing, with relentless winds and dry conditions meaning they get less reprieve at night to get on top of out-of-control blazes.", "The\u00a0Bureau of Metereology\u00a0and the\u00a0CSIRO\u00a0both say climate change has\u00a0led to longer bushfire seasons and an increase in the average number of high-risk fire days."]
